persons.name: Henri-LouisDuhamel du Monceau
persons.description: French physician, naval engineer and botanist. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: Charles-François Brisseaude Mirbel
persons.description: a French botanist and politician. He was a founder of the science of plant cytology.

persons.name: Henri-LouisDuhamel du Monceau
persons.description: French physician, naval engineer and botanist. ForMemRSL.

persons.name: Charles-François Brisseaude Mirbel
persons.description: a French botanist and politician. He was a founder of the science of plant cytology.

persons.name: JamesBrindley
persons.description: English canal engineer who invented the technique of puddling clay and using it to line canals.

persons.name: HeinrichSchrader
persons.description: It is possible Davy means Heinrich Schrader, a German botanist and mycologist.

persons.name: Henry CharlesEnglefield
persons.description: Seventh baronet from 1780 and a prominent Roman Catholic antiquarian and geologist. FRSL.

places.name: England
places.description: England is a country that is part of the United Kingdom. It is located on the island of Great Britain, of which it covers approximately 62%, and over 100 smaller adjacent islands.

persons.name: NehemiahGrew
persons.description: English plant anatomist and physiologist, known as the 'Father of Plant Anatomy'. FRSL.

persons.name: IsaacNewton
persons.description: Prominent English natural philosopher and mathematician greatly admired by Davy who once under the influence of several litres of nitrous oxide wrote in his notebook 'Davy & Newton' in one inch letters. FRSL.

persons.name: StephenHales
persons.description: English clergyman who made major contributions to a range of scientific fields including botany, pneumatic chemistry and physiology.  FRSL.

persons.name: Thomas AndrewKnight
persons.description: Knight was a botanist and horticulturalist. He was the second president of the Royal Horticulture Society. Davy frequently fished on Knight's esates in the Welsh Marches. FRSL.

persons.name: JosephPriestley
persons.description: Unitarian and political radical forced into exile in Pennsylvania. As a natural philospher and chemist who retained belief in phlogiston, he discovered oxygen and nitrous oxide though not under those names. FRSL.

persons.name: Joseph-MichelMontgolfier
persons.description: French co-inventor with his brother of the hot-air balloon; also invented the hydraulic ram (1796).

persons.name: Joseph-MichelMontgolfier
persons.description: French co-inventor with his brother of the hot-air balloon; also invented the hydraulic ram (1796).
